newsitem.title: UK: Copper remains flat during LME evening trade.
newsitem.headline: Copper remains flat during LME evening trade.

text.p: Copper prices languished around lower closing kerb levels during late Wednesday inter-office trading, albeit holding above chart support.

Traders said the weakness in copper was due to another overhead failure near $2,300, a fall in U.S. March housing starts, and news that a strike at Escondida in Chile later this week would not effect output.
Three months copper was indicated at $2,260/65 a tonne, while aluminium was quoted at $1,547/50.
